final_response:

1. Turn on your hazard lights and stay inside your vehicle
2. Move as far onto the shoulder as possible
3. Pop the hood of your car to alert other drivers
4. Place reflective markers behind your vehicle
5. Turn on your car's interior lights if you don't have markers
6. Avoid attempting mechanical or electrical fixes
7. Safely move a distance away from your car if you see smoke or flames
8. Call for roadside assistance or a tow truck
9. If your car stalls, evaluate the exterior and under the hood
10. Look to see that your battery is securely and correctly fashioned
